briefdescription.para: Computes the next power of two greater than or equal to x. Computes the next power of two greater than or equal to x.

memberdef.argsstring: (double next, double prev, double timenext, double time)
memberdef.name: interptime

memberdef.argsstring: (T q11, T q12, T q21, T q22, T x1, T x2, T y1, T y2, T x, T y)
memberdef.name: BilinearInterpolation

briefdescription.para: Bilinear interpolation within a rectangle. Bilinear interpolation within a rectangle defined by (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). The values at the corners of the rectangle are q11, q12, q21, and q22. The function returns the interpolated value at the point (x, y).

parameterdescription.para: x-coordinate of the point to interpolate
y-coordinate of the point to interpolate

memberdef.argsstring: (float q11, float q12, float q21, float q22, float x1, float x2, float y1, float y2, float x, float y)
memberdef.name: BilinearInterpolation< float >

memberdef.argsstring: (double q11, double q12, double q21, double q22, double x1, double x2, double y1, double y2, double x, double y)
memberdef.name: BilinearInterpolation< double >

memberdef.argsstring: (T q1, T x1, T y1, T q2, T x2, T y2, T q3, T x3, T y3, T x, T y)
memberdef.name: BarycentricInterpolation

briefdescription.para: Barycentric interpolation within a triangle. Barycentric interpolation within a triangle defined by the vertices (x1, y1), (x2, y2), and (x3, y3). The values at the vertices are q1, q2, and q3. The function returns the interpolated value at the point (x, y).

parameterdescription.para: x-coordinate of the point to interpolate
y-coordinate of the point to interpolate

memberdef.argsstring: (float q1, float x1, float y1, float q2, float x2, float y2, float q3, float x3, float y3, float x, float y)
memberdef.name: BarycentricInterpolation

memberdef.argsstring: (double q1, double x1, double y1, double q2, double x2, double y2, double q3, double x3, double y3, double x, double y)
memberdef.name: BarycentricInterpolation

briefdescription.para: Calculate the grid resolution at a given refinement level. Calculate the grid resolution at a given refinement level. If level is negative, the resolution is coarsened (doubled for each level). If level is positive, the resolution is refined (halved for each level).

parameterdescription.para: The refinement level (negative for coarsening, positive for refining).

simplesect.para: The calculated grid resolution at the specified level.

briefdescription.para: Calculate the grid resolution at a given refinement level, considering spherical coordinates. Calculate the grid resolution at a given refinement level, considering spherical coordinates. If level is negative, the resolution is coarsened (doubled for each level). If level is positive, the resolution is refined (halved for each level). If the grid is spherical, the resolution is adjusted by the Earth's radius and converted from degrees to meters.

parameterdescription.para: The parameter object containing grid settings.
The refinement level (negative for coarsening, positive for refining).

simplesect.para: The calculated grid resolution at the specified level, adjusted for spherical coordinates if applicable.

memberdef.argsstring: (T theta, T s0, T s1, T s2)
memberdef.name: minmod2

briefdescription.para: Minmod limiter function for slope limiting in numerical schemes. Minmod limiter function for slope limiting in numerical schemes. The function takes a parameter theta and three slope values (s0, s1, s2). Theta is used to tune the limiting (theta=1 gives minmod, the most dissipative limiter, and theta=2 gives superbee, the least dissipative). The function returns the limited slope value based on the input slopes and theta. Usual value : float theta = 1.3f;.

parameterdescription.para: The tuning parameter for the limiter (between 1 and 2).
The slope value at the left cell.
The slope value at the center cell.
The slope value at the right cell.

memberdef.argsstring: (float theta, float s0, float s1, float s2)
memberdef.name: minmod2

memberdef.argsstring: (double theta, double s0, double s1, double s2)
memberdef.name: minmod2

memberdef.argsstring: (T Axmin, T Axmax, T Aymin, T Aymax, T Bxmin, T Bxmax, T Bymin, T Bymax)
memberdef.name: OBBdetect

briefdescription.para: Overlapping Bounding Box detection. Overlapping Bounding Box detection to determine if two axis-aligned bounding boxes overlap. The function takes the minimum and maximum coordinates of two bounding boxes (A and B). It returns true if the bounding boxes overlap, and false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
Axmin
Minimum x-coordinate of bounding box A.
Axmax
Maximum x-coordinate of bounding box A.
Aymin
Minimum y-coordinate of bounding box A.
Aymax
Maximum y-coordinate of bounding box A.
Bxmin
Minimum x-coordinate of bounding box B.
Bxmax
Maximum x-coordinate of bounding box B.
Bymin
Minimum y-coordinate of bounding box B.
Bymax
Maximum y-coordinate of bounding box B.
True if the bounding boxes overlap, false otherwise.
Overlaping Bounding Box to detect which cell river falls into. It is the simplest version of the algorythm where the bounding box are paralle;l to the axis

memberdef.argsstring: (float Axmin, float Axmax, float Aymin, float Aymax, float Bxmin, float Bxmax, float Bymin, float Bymax)
memberdef.name: OBBdetect

memberdef.argsstring: (double Axmin, double Axmax, double Aymin, double Aymax, double Bxmin, double Bxmax, double Bymin, double Bymax)
memberdef.name: OBBdetect

briefdescription.para: Converts a floating-point number to the nearest integer. Converts a floating-point number to the nearest integer. The function rounds the value to the nearest integer, rounding halfway cases away from zero.
Returns the sign of a number. Returns the sign of a number.
